commit message:
statically linked gpgv2 as 'gpgv' for debootstrap

this binary is built using: https://github.com/guardianproject/gnupg-for-android
build pkgdetails from source instead of using binary in git
added complete build and assembly instructions for the current state of things
ignore files generated in Android build process
updated to committing new standard ant.properties and project.properties
rename DebiHelper to NativeHelper to make it more generally meaningful
update .classpath for new SDK project style
test for /usr/bin/ssh-keygen, then show key fingerprint and randomart
auto-formatted all XML files
use monospace font for console log
use Debian policy-rc.d to exclude the execution init.d scripts which mess with Android
fixed warnings in AndroidManifest.xml
added WakeLocks to Install and a preference for tying it to Start/Stop Debian
More verbose echoing of the intermediate steps (useful for debugging)
exit if debootstrap stage 1 failed
More verbose echoing of intermediate steps, part two
More verbose in start/stop debian script
add whitesapce in start-debian output to make it look more sensible
use ellipsis character to get rid of warning in strings.xml
actually make 'Start Debian' wake lock controlled by the preference
if no Debian setup, check for network connection, and refuse to install without one
check that 'Image Size:' value will fit into available space on SD Card
build busybox to provide ar, echo, dpkg-deb, grep, patch, wget, gunzip, bunzip2, mkfs_ext2, losetup, lsof, sed, etc. (Closes #17)
install and setup busybox symlinks so debootstrap automatically uses our version of our busybox utils
check for included debian-archive-keyring.gpg and use it to validate packages
try harder to find fsck.ext2
move the 'modprobe ext2' to the scripts and use grep to text for ext2 support before running modprobe
actually install policy-rc.d script
beautify echo messages during install
link /bin to $app_bin now, since that's where the busybox stuff is now installed
test if loopdev is still setup before running 'losetup -d' on it to prevent spurious errors
include keyring for debootstrap package validation (included from debian-archive-keyring_2010.08.28_all.deb)
busybox's dpkg-deb does not work with debootstrap, so don't include it
build busybox with all the of the UNIX commands that we require, since vendors are flaky with what they include
exit the install process if the second stage of debootstrap fails
change scripts to use the included busybox commands before trying the vendor-supplied versions
move debootstrap building to external/
remove duplicate source for pkgdetails
build usr-share-debootstrap.tar.bz2 by downloading the .deb, patching, and tarring it up
bump version to 0.2
remove defunct, unused scripts
(assets/debian) use the chroot included in LilDebi, otherwise fail over to a possible system one
set OnBootService to be unexported so nothing else can use it

switched to using full debootstrap .deb instead of .udeb to get all the scripts

Thanks to Stephan Götter for figuring the original problem

move DEBOOTSTRAP_DIR declration earlier so that its declared when its needed for creating the image

Thanks to Stephan Götter for figuring the original problem
log the actual install commands that are executed to the install.log
include app_bin in the PATH for ./configure-downloaded-image.sh
updated instructions to represent current build process (thanks thehunmonkgroup for some key details)
ignore proguard-project.txt, its unused generated by 'android update project'
rename debootstrap tarball for clarity and update README description of it
make syntax for launching root shells more compatible, some 'su' binaries have different flags
move the Debian chroot mountpoint to /debian so that non-root users can access it
move 'debian' script for getting a chroot shell to '/debian/shell'
update busybox config to include more missing UNIX tools (id, printf, touch, md5sum, uname, wc)
added busybox sh/ash/bash for running the scripts, the built-in 'sh' doesn't always support 'trap'
upgraded debootstrap to version 1.0.42
added section to README about using the pre-built disk image
stop-debian.sh and start-debian.sh need args in order to run properly in other scripts (Closes: #25)
did survey of debootstrap and tried to include busybox versions of everything it needs
make busybox install using the plain 'su' since the CommandThread uses busybox's sh now
fix gpgv validation in the second stage of debootstrap, which should give us complete validation
debootstrap uses 'head' so build into busybox, and throw in 'tail' and 'expr' while I'm at it
switch debug output of create-debian-setup.sh to use 'set -x' instead of my manual technique
eclipse insists on adding this to the .classpath, so I'll commit it

prefer the built-in mke2fs since it seems to be a lot more reliable

the included busybox mke2fs sometimes fails to make a mountable fs
ignore vendor folders in assets: Samsung includes 'kioskmode' and Motorola includes 'databases'
add a 8192 buffer size to the BufferedReader to get rid of warning message in logcat

update unzipDebiFiles() to better handle unexpected directories in the assets

https://annoyingtechnicaldetails.wordpress.com/2012/08/09/fighting-to-simplify-androids-assetmanager/

switched to /dev/block/loop7 as static loopdev as lame workaround to loopdev collisions

it seems that the loopdevs are allocated starting from 0, and that Android
is generally setup with 8 loopdevs by default. Ideally the app should request
a free loopdev using `losetup -f`, but that's not implemented yet.
use 'su -s' instead of 'su --shell' since older 'su' binaries don't understand --shell
install/configure a default locale first to tame the warnings (Closes: #29)
manually stop sshd in create-debian-setup.sh so that stop-debian.sh can succesfully stop everything (Closes: #32)
updated to busybox v1.20.2

Revert 'upgraded debootstrap to version 1.0.42' since its broken in this app

This reverts commit 4bedb190b400b27ea3b65fb4ecbbf66faf0b98ee.

disable gpgv checking in debootstrap 2nd round since its failing (related to #20)

its not quite clear what is failing, it seemed like maybe its the sha1sum
or something. unfortunately, the latest debootstrap fails even worse. I've
filed a bug report there:  http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=684520
fix create_mountpoint to work with all combinations of base/mnt dir existance (closes #24)
search for an e2fsck/fsck.ext2 to use (fsck alone is not enough)
stop-debian.sh: prevent the lsof file open check from finding the debian.img itself (closes #12)
